Navigation.helpDescription: Navigation arrow (chevron) is shown in the table rows/items.

ControlChange.helpDescription: Triggered by connected control after processing valuehelp output

ariaLabelledBy.description: Association to controls / IDs that label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).
ariaLabelledBy.helpDescription: Association to controls / IDs that label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

fieldHelp.description: Optional FieldHelp. This is an association that allows the usage of one FieldHelp instance for multiple fields. Note: If the field is inside of a table, do not set the FieldHelp instance as dependent to the field. If you do every field instance in every table row gets a clone of it. Put the FieldHelp instance e.g. as dependent on the table or page. The FieldHelp instance must be somewhere in the control tree, otherwise there might be rendering or update issues. Note: For Boolean fields, no FieldHelp should be added, but a default FieldHelp used instead.
fieldHelp.helpDescription: Optional FieldHelp. This is an association that allows the usage of one FieldHelp instance for multiple fields. Note: If the field is inside of a table, do not set the FieldHelp instance as dependent to the field. If you do every field instance in every table row gets a clone of it. Put the FieldHelp instance e.g. as dependent on the table or page. The FieldHelp instance must be somewhere in the control tree, otherwise there might be rendering or update issues. Note: For Boolean fields, no FieldHelp should be added, but a default FieldHelp used instead.

sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase.description: The FieldBase control is the basic control to be used within the {@link sap.ui.mdc.Field Field} and {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} controls. It must not be used stand-alone.
sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new FieldBase. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getDataType dataType} : string (default: 'sap.ui.model.type.String')
    • {@link #getDataTypeConstraints dataTypeConstraints} : object
    • {@link #getDataTypeFormatOptions dataTypeFormatOptions} : object
    • {@link #getEditMode editMode} : sap.ui.mdc.enum.EditMode (default: Editable)
    • {@link #getRequired required} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getDisplay display} : sap.ui.mdc.enum.FieldDisplay (default: Value)
    • {@link #getTextAlign textAlign} : sap.ui.core.TextAlign (default: Initial)
    • {@link #getTextDirection textDirection} : sap.ui.core.TextDirection (default: Inherit)
    • {@link #getPlaceholder placeholder} : string (default: "")
    • {@link #getValueState valueState} : sap.ui.core.ValueState (default: None)
    • {@link #getValueStateText valueStateText} : string
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getMultipleLines multipleLines} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getMaxConditions maxConditions} : int (default: -1)
    • {@link #getConditions conditions} : object[] (default: [])
    • {@link #getLabel label} : string (default: "")
    • {@link #getDelegate delegate} : object (default: ...see text or source)
    • {@link #getShowEmptyIndicator showEmptyIndicator} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #get_fieldHelpEnabled _fieldHelpEnabled} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #get_ariaAttributes _ariaAttributes} : object (default: {})
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control (default)
    • {@link #getContentEdit contentEdit} : sap.ui.core.Control
    • {@link #getContentDisplay contentDisplay} : sap.ui.core.Control
    • {@link #getFieldInfo fieldInfo} : sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldInfoBase
  • Associations
    • {@link #getFieldHelp fieldHelp} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.mdc.ValueHelp)
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:liveChange liveChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:press press} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:submit submit} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.mdc.Control#constructor sap.ui.mdc.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase.helpDescription: The FieldBase control is the basic control to be used within the {@link sap.ui.mdc.Field Field} and {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} controls. It must not be used stand-alone.

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

contentEdit.description: Optional content to be rendered if the editMode property is not set to Display. Note: If a control is assigned to the content aggregation, this one is ignored. Note: Bind the value-holding property of the control to '$field>/conditions' using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionsType ConditionsType} as type. If the control needs to show multiple conditions, bind its aggregation to '$field>/conditions'. Bind the item controls value-holding property using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionType ConditionType} as type. Warning: Only controls allowed in a {@link sap.ui.layout.form.Form Form} are allowed to be used for this optional content. Other controls might break the layout. This means the {@link sap.ui.core.IFormContent IFormContent} interface needs to be implemented by these controls.
contentEdit.helpDescription: Optional content to be rendered if the editMode property is not set to Display. Note: If a control is assigned to the content aggregation, this one is ignored. Note: Bind the value-holding property of the control to '$field>/conditions' using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionsType ConditionsType} as type. If the control needs to show multiple conditions, bind its aggregation to '$field>/conditions'. Bind the item controls value-holding property using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionType ConditionType} as type. Warning: Only controls allowed in a {@link sap.ui.layout.form.Form Form} are allowed to be used for this optional content. Other controls might break the layout. This means the {@link sap.ui.core.IFormContent IFormContent} interface needs to be implemented by these controls.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

Note: The visualization of the ValueState property is handled by the inner rendered control. If a control is set (using content, contentEdit, or contentDisplay), this control needs to support the valueState behavior, otherwise valueState is not visualized.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

_fieldHelpEnabled.helpDescription: Internal property to bind the showValueHelp property of the internal Input control.

_ariaAttributes.helpDescription: Sets the ARIA attributes added to the inner control. The object contains ARIA attributes in an aria node. Additional attributes, such as role, autocomplete or valueHelpEnabled, are added on root level.

delegate.description:
Path to FieldBaseDelegate module that provides the required APIs to execute model-specific logic.
Note: Ensure that the related file can be requested (any required library has to be loaded before that).
Do not bind or modify the module. Once the required module is associated, this property might not be needed any longer.

fieldGroupIds.description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is fired. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

placeholder.description: Defines a short hint intended to aid the user with data entry when the control has no value. If the value is null no placeholder is shown. Note: If the rendered control doesn't support this feature, this property is ignored.
placeholder.helpDescription: Defines a short hint intended to aid the user with data entry when the control has no value. If the value is null no placeholder is shown. Note: If the rendered control doesn't support this feature, this property is ignored.

id.description: Unique ID of this instance. If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework. AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for Ids that the application (or other code) creates. It can be configured option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link sap.ui.core.Configuration}.

maxConditions.description: Sets the maximum amount of conditions that are allowed for this field. The default value of -1 indicates that an unlimited amount of conditions can be defined. Note If the data type used doesn't support multiple conditions, an error is thrown.
maxConditions.helpDescription: Sets the maximum amount of conditions that are allowed for this field. The default value of -1 indicates that an unlimited amount of conditions can be defined. Note If the data type used doesn't support multiple conditions, an error is thrown.

bindingContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

multipleLines.description: If set, the Field is rendered using a multi-line control. This property only affects types that support multiple lines. This property is only used for single-value fields. Note If the data type used doesn't support multiple lines an error is thrown.
multipleLines.helpDescription: If set, the Field is rendered using a multi-line control. This property only affects types that support multiple lines. This property is only used for single-value fields. Note If the data type used doesn't support multiple lines an error is thrown.

visible.description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.

If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.

dataTypeFormatOptions.description: The format options of the type specified in dataType.
dataTypeFormatOptions.helpDescription: The format options of the type specified in dataType.

textAlign.description: Defines the horizontal alignment of the text that is shown inside the input field. Note: If the rendered control doesn't support this feature, this property is ignored.
textAlign.helpDescription: Defines the horizontal alignment of the text that is shown inside the input field. Note: If the rendered control doesn't support this feature, this property is ignored.

dataTypeConstraints.helpDescription: The constraints of the type specified in dataType.

dataType.description: The type of data handled by the field. This type is used to parse, format, and validate the value.
dataType.helpDescription: The type of data handled by the field. This type is used to parse, format, and validate the value.

display.helpDescription: Defines whether the value and/or description of the field is shown and in what order.

This can be used by {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar FilterBar} or {@link sap.ui.layout.form.Form Form} controls to create a {@link sap.m.Label Label} control for the field.

metadataContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected. The special setting is only for internal use.

showEmptyIndicator.description: If set, an empty Field renders an empty-indicator in display mode. This property only takes effect if editMode is set to Display. Note Empty means the Field holds no value. If an empty string is a valid value, the Field might show nothing, depending on the display settings and assigned description or FieldHelp.
showEmptyIndicator.helpDescription: If set, an empty Field renders an empty-indicator in display mode. This property only takes effect if editMode is set to Display. Note Empty means the Field holds no value. If an empty string is a valid value, the Field might show nothing, depending on the display settings and assigned description or FieldHelp.

editMode.description: Determines whether the field is editable, read-only, or disabled.
editMode.helpDescription: Determines whether the field is editable, read-only, or disabled.

width.description: Defines the width of the control.
width.helpDescription: Defines the width of the control.

conditions.description:
Sets the conditions that represent the values of the field. This should be bound to a {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel} using the corresponding fieldPath. Note: For {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} controls, the conditions property must be used to bind {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} to a {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel}.
For example, for a {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} control inside a {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar FilterBar} control the binding looks like this:
conditions="{$filters>/conditions/propertyPath}" with the following data:
  • $filters as the name of the condition model
  • /conditions/ as a required static part of the binding
  • propertyPath as the property name
For an Any (see {@link sap.ui.model.FilterOperator}) {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} control, the binding looks like this:
conditions='{$filters>/conditions/navPath*/propertyPath}' with the following data:
  • $filters as the name of the condition model
  • /conditions/ as a required static part of the binding
  • navPath#42;/ as the navigation property name
  • propertyPath as the property name
Between navPath and propertyPath, */ is required. Note: A condition must have the structure of {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionObject ConditionObject}.
conditions.helpDescription:
Sets the conditions that represent the values of the field. This should be bound to a {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel} using the corresponding fieldPath. Note: For {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} controls, the conditions property must be used to bind {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} to a {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel}.
For example, for a {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} control inside a {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar FilterBar} control the binding looks like this:
conditions="{$filters>/conditions/propertyPath}" with the following data:
  • $filters as the name of the condition model
  • /conditions/ as a required static part of the binding
  • propertyPath as the property name
For an Any (see {@link sap.ui.model.FilterOperator}) {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} control, the binding looks like this:
conditions='{$filters>/conditions/navPath*/propertyPath}' with the following data:
  • $filters as the name of the condition model
  • /conditions/ as a required static part of the binding
  • navPath#42;/ as the navigation property name
  • propertyPath as the property name
Between navPath and propertyPath, */ is required. Note: A condition must have the structure of {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionObject ConditionObject}.

sap.ui.mdc.actiontoolbar.ActionToolbarAc.description: The action for an {@link sap.ui.mdc.ActionToolbar ActionToolbar}) control
sap.ui.mdc.actiontoolbar.ActionToolbarAc.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ActionToolbarAction.
Note:
The control is experimental and the API / behavior is not finalized. It should only be used internally in other mdc controls (e.g. chart/table).
Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getLayoutInformation layoutInformation} : object (default: ...see text or source)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getAction action} : sap.ui.core.Control (default)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.mdc.actiontoolbar.ActionToolbarAc.helpDescription: The action for an {@link sap.ui.mdc.ActionToolbar ActionToolbar}) control

layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

sap.ui.mdc.name: sap.ui.mdc
sap.ui.mdc.description:
The SAPUI5 library that contains the metadata-driven controls and other entities.

SAP Internal This library is restricted to use by SAP internal projects only.

sap.ui.mdc.Element.description: The base class for MDC composite elements providing delegate-related functionality (see {@link sap.ui.mdc.mixin.DelegateMixin}).
sap.ui.mdc.Element.constructorDescription:

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getDelegate delegate} : object
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

If the change event is synchronous, the promise has already been already resolved. If it is asynchronous, it will be resolved after the value has been updated. The Field should be set to busy during the parsing to prevent user input. As there might be a whole group of fields that needs to be busy, this cannot be done automatically.

Note: this association may only be assigned once.

Note: this association is only required, for being able to get information from {@link topic:a8e55aa2f8bc4127923b20685a6d1621 SAPUI5 Flexibility} whenever a variant was applied, with 'apply automatically' set to true. Note: this association may only be assigned once.

sap.ui.mdc.filterbar.vh.FilterBar.description:
The FilterBar control is used to display filter properties in a user-friendly manner to populate values for a query. The filters are arranged in a logical row that is divided depending on the space available and the width of the filters. The Go button triggers the search event, and the Show Filters button shows the additional filter field.
The FilterBar control creates and handles the filters based on the provided metadata information. The metadata information is provided via the {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBarDelegate FilterBarDelegate} implementation. This implementation has to be provided by the application.
sap.ui.mdc.filterbar.vh.FilterBar.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new FilterBar. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getExpandFilterFields expandFilterFields} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getFilterFieldThreshold filterFieldThreshold} : int (default: 8)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.mdc.filterbar.FilterBarBase#constructor sap.ui.mdc.filterbar.FilterBarBase} can be used as well.
sap.ui.mdc.filterbar.vh.FilterBar.helpDescription:
The FilterBar control is used to display filter properties in a user-friendly manner to populate values for a query. The filters are arranged in a logical row that is divided depending on the space available and the width of the filters. The Go button triggers the search event, and the Show Filters button shows the additional filter field.
The FilterBar control creates and handles the filters based on the provided metadata information. The metadata information is provided via the {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBarDelegate FilterBarDelegate} implementation. This implementation has to be provided by the application.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar.description:
The FilterBar control is used to display filter properties in a user-friendly manner to populate values for a query. The filters are arranged in a logical row that is divided depending on the space available and the width of the filters. The Go button triggers the search event, and the Advanced Filters button shows the filter dialog.
The FilterBar control creates and handles the filters based on the provided metadata information. The metadata information is provided via the {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBarDelegate FilterBarDelegate} implementation. This implementation has to be provided by the application.
sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new FilterBar. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getShowAdaptFiltersButton showAdaptFiltersButton} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getP13nMode p13nMode} : sap.ui.mdc.FilterBarP13nMode[]
    • {@link #get_p13nModeItem _p13nModeItem} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #get_p13nModeValue _p13nModeValue} : boolean (default: false)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.mdc.filterbar.FilterBarBase#constructor sap.ui.mdc.filterbar.FilterBarBase} can be used as well.

eventParams.oControlEvent.getParameters.promise: type: Promise, description: Returns a Promise for the change. The Promise returns the value if it is resolved. If the change event is synchronous, the promise has already been already resolved. If it is asynchronous, it will be resolved after the value has been updated. The Field should be set to busy during the parsing to prevent user input. As there might be a whole group of fields that needs to be busy, this cannot be done automatically.
eventParams.oControlEvent.getParameters.value: type: string, description: The new value of the Field. If a FieldHelp is assigned to the Field, the value is used as key for the FieldHelp items.

ariaLabelledBy.description: Association to controls / IDs that label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).
ariaLabelledBy.helpDescription: Association to controls / IDs that label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

fieldHelp.description: Optional FieldHelp. This is an association that allows the usage of one FieldHelp instance for multiple fields. Note: If the field is inside of a table, do not set the FieldHelp instance as dependent to the field. If you do every field instance in every table row gets a clone of it. Put the FieldHelp instance e.g. as dependent on the table or page. The FieldHelp instance must be somewhere in the control tree, otherwise there might be rendering or update issues. Note: For Boolean fields, no FieldHelp should be added, but a default FieldHelp used instead.
fieldHelp.helpDescription: Optional FieldHelp. This is an association that allows the usage of one FieldHelp instance for multiple fields. Note: If the field is inside of a table, do not set the FieldHelp instance as dependent to the field. If you do every field instance in every table row gets a clone of it. Put the FieldHelp instance e.g. as dependent on the table or page. The FieldHelp instance must be somewhere in the control tree, otherwise there might be rendering or update issues. Note: For Boolean fields, no FieldHelp should be added, but a default FieldHelp used instead.

sap.ui.mdc.FilterField.description: The FilterField control is used to filter data based on the conditions. The conditions are managed in the corresponding {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel}. That is why the conditions property must be bound to the related conditions in the {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel}. The type of this data must be defined in the dataType property.
sap.ui.mdc.FilterField.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new FilterField. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getOperators operators} : string[] (default: [])
    • {@link #getDefaultOperator defaultOperator} : string
  • Events
    • {@link #event:change change} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase#constructor sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase} can be used as well.
sap.ui.mdc.FilterField.helpDescription: The FilterField control is used to filter data based on the conditions. The conditions are managed in the corresponding {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel}. That is why the conditions property must be bound to the related conditions in the {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel}. The type of this data must be defined in the dataType property.

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

contentEdit.description: Optional content to be rendered if the editMode property is not set to Display. Note: If a control is assigned to the content aggregation, this one is ignored. Note: Bind the value-holding property of the control to '$field>/conditions' using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionsType ConditionsType} as type. If the control needs to show multiple conditions, bind its aggregation to '$field>/conditions'. Bind the item controls value-holding property using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionType ConditionType} as type. Warning: Only controls allowed in a {@link sap.ui.layout.form.Form Form} are allowed to be used for this optional content. Other controls might break the layout. This means the {@link sap.ui.core.IFormContent IFormContent} interface needs to be implemented by these controls.
contentEdit.helpDescription: Optional content to be rendered if the editMode property is not set to Display. Note: If a control is assigned to the content aggregation, this one is ignored. Note: Bind the value-holding property of the control to '$field>/conditions' using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionsType ConditionsType} as type. If the control needs to show multiple conditions, bind its aggregation to '$field>/conditions'. Bind the item controls value-holding property using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionType ConditionType} as type. Warning: Only controls allowed in a {@link sap.ui.layout.form.Form Form} are allowed to be used for this optional content. Other controls might break the layout. This means the {@link sap.ui.core.IFormContent IFormContent} interface needs to be implemented by these controls.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.
tooltip.helpDescription: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

conditions.description:
Sets the conditions that represent the values of the field. This should be bound to a {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel} using the corresponding fieldPath. Note: For {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} controls, the conditions property must be used to bind {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} to a {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel}.
For example, for a {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} control inside a {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar FilterBar} control the binding looks like this:
conditions="{$filters>/conditions/propertyPath}" with the following data:
  • $filters as the name of the condition model
  • /conditions/ as a required static part of the binding
  • propertyPath as the property name
For an Any (see {@link sap.ui.model.FilterOperator}) {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} control, the binding looks like this:
conditions='{$filters>/conditions/navPath*/propertyPath}' with the following data:
  • $filters as the name of the condition model
  • /conditions/ as a required static part of the binding
  • navPath#42;/ as the navigation property name
  • propertyPath as the property name
Between navPath and propertyPath, */ is required. Note: A condition must have the structure of {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionObject ConditionObject}.
conditions.helpDescription:

Note: For {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} controls, the conditions property must be used to bind {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} to a {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel}.
For example, for a {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} control inside a {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar FilterBar} control the binding looks like this:
conditions="{$filters>/conditions/propertyPath}" with the following data:
  • $filters as the name of the condition model
  • /conditions/ as a required static part of the binding
  • propertyPath as the property name
For an Any (see {@link sap.ui.model.FilterOperator}) {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} control, the binding looks like this:
conditions='{$filters>/conditions/navPath*/propertyPath}' with the following data:
  • $filters as the name of the condition model
  • /conditions/ as a required static part of the binding
  • navPath#42;/ as the navigation property name
  • propertyPath as the property name
Between navPath and propertyPath, */ is required. Note: A condition must have the structure of {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionObject ConditionObject}.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

sap.ui.mdc.field.BoolFieldHelp.constructorDescription: Constructor for a new BoolFieldHelp. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. This class does not have its own settings, but all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldHelpBase#constructor sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldHelpBase} can be used.
sap.ui.mdc.field.BoolFieldHelp.helpDescription: A field help used in the FieldHelp association in FieldBase controls that shows a list for Boolean values.

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.
tooltip.helpDescription: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

validateInput.description:
If this property is set, the user input is validated against the field help. If no entry is found for the user input, an error occurs.

If this property is not set, the user input is still checked against the field help. But if no entry is found, the user input is set to the field if the used data type allows this. (A type parsing error is shown if the user input adheres to the requirements of the used data type.)

sap.ui.mdc.p13n.UIManager.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new UIManager.
This registry creates and manages default persistence providers for each persistence mode.
It is intended for use cases where no dedicated provider can or should be created by an application.
The UIManager currently resides in the Engine and must never be called separately.

type: boolean, description: Indicator of item is chosen via press or enter or via a selection

Depending of the field help logic the field help needs to be closed on click, but not on multi-selection. (If a Table is used, clicking an item in the suggestion closes it bit activation the check box not.)

since: 1.76.0

sap.ui.mdc.ValueHelp.description: Element for the FieldHelp association in the {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase FieldBase} controls.
sap.ui.mdc.ValueHelp.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ValueHelp. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getConditions conditions} : object[] (default: [])
    • {@link #getDelegate delegate} : object (default: ...see text or source)
    • {@link #getFilterValue filterValue} : string (default: "") (default)
    • {@link #getValidateInput validateInput} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #get_config _config} : object (default: {})
    • {@link #get_valid _valid} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getDialog dialog} : sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.IDialogContainer
    • {@link #getTypeahead typeahead} : sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.ITypeaheadContainer
  • Events
    • {@link #event:select select} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:disconnect disconnect} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:closed closed} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:navigated navigated} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:switchToValueHelp switchToValueHelp} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.mdc.Element#constructor sap.ui.mdc.Element} can be used as well.
sap.ui.mdc.ValueHelp.helpDescription: Element for the FieldHelp association in the {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase FieldBase} controls.

sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldValueHelp.description: A field help used in the FieldHelp association of controls based on {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase FieldBase} that shows a value help dialog.
sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldValueHelp.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new FieldValueHelp. If a more complex value help is needed, the application can add a table to this field help. As the behavior depends on the used table control in this case, a wrapper is used between the used control and the FieldValueHelp element. Note: If a FieldValueHelp element is connected to a field, it gets the BindingContext of this field. So the in and out parameters are done in this context. Therefore bind the content table in such a way that that it finds its data also in the BindingContext of the field. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getDelegate delegate} : object (default: ...see text or source)
    • {@link #getFilterFields filterFields} : string (default: "")
    • {@link #getKeyPath keyPath} : string (default: "")
    • {@link #getDescriptionPath descriptionPath} : string (default: "")
    • {@link #getShowConditionPanel showConditionPanel} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string (default: "")
    • {@link #getNoDialog noDialog} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getCaseSensitive caseSensitive} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #get_enableOK _enableOK} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldValueHelpContentWrapperBase (default)
    • {@link #getSuggestContent suggestContent} : sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldValueHelpContentWrapperBase
    • {@link #getDialogContent dialogContent} : sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldValueHelpContentWrapperBase
    • {@link #getFilterBar filterBar} : sap.ui.mdc.filterbar.FilterBarBase
    • {@link #getInParameters inParameters} : sap.ui.mdc.field.InParameter[]
    • {@link #getOutParameters outParameters} : sap.ui.mdc.field.OutParameter[]
    • {@link #getCollectiveSearchItems collectiveSearchItems} : sap.ui.core.Item[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:dataRequested dataRequested} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldHelpBase#constructor sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldHelpBase} can be used as well.
sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldValueHelp.helpDescription: A field help used in the FieldHelp association of controls based on {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase FieldBase} that shows a value help dialog.

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

inParameters.description:
Sets the in parameters of a field help.

If set, the field help reads the data of these entities in the model and uses it to filter in the value help.
inParameters.helpDescription:
Sets the in parameters of a field help.

If set, the field help reads the data of these entities in the model and uses it to filter in the value help.

suggestContent.description: Content for suggestion. To support different types of content (for example sap.m.Table), a specific wrapper is used to map the functionality of the content control to the field help. The content control is assigned to the wrapper. The filter logic must be implemented in the wrapper control. The filtering is triggered by user interaction (type-ahead, search request, or search from FilterBar). (If FilterBar is in LiveMode and in parameters are used, this also triggers filtering.) Note: If no special content for suggestion is provided, the content of the content aggregation is used.
suggestContent.helpDescription: Content for suggestion. To support different types of content (for example sap.m.Table), a specific wrapper is used to map the functionality of the content control to the field help. The content control is assigned to the wrapper. The filter logic must be implemented in the wrapper control. The filtering is triggered by user interaction (type-ahead, search request, or search from FilterBar). (If FilterBar is in LiveMode and in parameters are used, this also triggers filtering.) Note: If no special content for suggestion is provided, the content of the content aggregation is used.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.
tooltip.helpDescription: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

customData.helpDescription: Custom Data, a data structure like a map containing arbitrary key value pairs.

_filterBar.helpDescription: Internal FilterBar control of the field help. (If no external FilterBar used.)

collectiveSearchItems.description: Items for collective searches. If used, a field to switch value helps will be shown. If the value help is switched, the contentRequest function of the delegate is called and the chosen key is provided. Note: Icons are not supported.

outParameters.description:
Sets the out parameters of a field help.

If set, the fields sets the data of these entities in the model based to the selected values.
outParameters.helpDescription:
Sets the out parameters of a field help.

If set, the fields sets the data of these entities in the model based to the selected values.

dependents.description: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.
dependents.helpDescription: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.

descriptionPath.description: The path of the description field in the content binding. If a table is used as content, this is the binding path of the description of the items.
descriptionPath.helpDescription: The path of the description field in the content binding. If a table is used as content, this is the binding path of the description of the items.

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

objectBindings.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

caseSensitive.description: If this property is set to true, the filtering for user input is always case-sensitive. Otherwise user input is checked case-insensitively. If $search is used, this property has no effect on the $search request. If the used back-end service supports a case-insensitive search, set this property to false.
caseSensitive.helpDescription: If this property is set to true, the filtering for user input is always case-sensitive. Otherwise user input is checked case-insensitively. If $search is used, this property has no effect on the $search request. If the used back-end service supports a case-insensitive search, set this property to false.

keyPath.description:
The path of the key field in the content binding. If a table is used as content, this is the binding path of the key of the items.

If not set, the FieldPath of the assigned field is used.
keyPath.helpDescription:
The path of the key field in the content binding. If a table is used as content, this is the binding path of the key of the items.

If not set, the FieldPath of the assigned field is used.

filterFields.description: The fields based on which the table data is filtered. For filtering the value of the filterValue property is used. If set to $search and the used binding supports search requests, a $search request is used for filtering. If set to one or more properties, the filters for these properties are used for filtering. These filters are set on the ListBinding used. The properties need to be separated by commas and enclosed by "*" characters. ("*Property1,Property2*") If it is empty, no suggestion is available.
filterFields.helpDescription: The fields based on which the table data is filtered. For filtering the value of the filterValue property is used. If set to $search and the used binding supports search requests, a $search request is used for filtering. If set to one or more properties, the filters for these properties are used for filtering. These filters are set on the ListBinding used. The properties need to be separated by commas and enclosed by "*" characters. ("*Property1,Property2*") If it is empty, no suggestion is available.

title.description: Title text that appears in the dialog header.
title.helpDescription: Title text that appears in the dialog header.

showConditionPanel.description: Determines if a condition panel is shown.
showConditionPanel.helpDescription: Determines if a condition panel is shown.

metadataContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected. The special setting is only for internal use.

delegate.description: Defines the module path of the metadata delegate.
delegate.helpDescription: Defines the module path of the metadata delegate.

filterValue.description: The value by which the help is filtered. Note: This only takes effect if the FieldHelp element supports filtering. Note: This property must only be set by the control the FieldHelp element belongs to, not by the application.
filterValue.helpDescription: The value by which the help is filtered. Note: This only takes effect if the FieldHelp element supports filtering. Note: This property must only be set by the control the FieldHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

validateInput.description:
If this property is set, the user input is validated against the field help. If no entry is found for the user input, an error occurs.

If this property is not set, the user input is still checked against the field help. But if no entry is found, the user input is set to the field if the used data type allows this. (A type parsing error is shown if the user input adheres to the requirements of the used data type.)
validateInput.helpDescription:
If this property is set, the user input is validated against the field help. If no entry is found for the user input, an error occurs.

If this property is not set, the user input is still checked against the field help. But if no entry is found, the user input is set to the field if the used data type allows this. (A type parsing error is shown if the user input adheres to the requirements of the used data type.)

_enableOK.description: Internal property to bind the OK button to enable or disable it.
_enableOK.helpDescription: Internal property to bind the OK button to enable or disable it.

noDialog.description: If set, the field help doesn't open a value help dialog, but just displays the content. It behaves like in the case of a suggestion but without any search.
noDialog.helpDescription: If set, the field help doesn't open a value help dialog, but just displays the content. It behaves like in the case of a suggestion but without any search.

id.description: Unique ID of this instance. If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework. AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for Ids that the application (or other code) creates. It can be configured option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link sap.ui.core.Configuration}.

conditions.description: The conditions of the selected items. Note: This property must only be set by the control the FieldHelp element belongs to, not by the application. Note: A condition must have the structure of {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionObject ConditionObject}.
conditions.helpDescription: The conditions of the selected items. Note: This property must only be set by the control the FieldHelp element belongs to, not by the application. Note: A condition must have the structure of {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionObject ConditionObject}.

bindingContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

sap.ui.mdc.table.GridTableType.description: The table type info class for the metadata-driven table.
sap.ui.mdc.table.GridTableType.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new GridTableType. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getRowCountMode rowCountMode} : sap.ui.mdc.RowCountMode (default: Auto)
    • {@link #getRowCount rowCount} : int (default: 10)
    • {@link #getSelectionLimit selectionLimit} : int (default: 200)
    • {@link #getShowHeaderSelector showHeaderSelector} : boolean (default: true)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.mdc.table.TableTypeBase#constructor sap.ui.mdc.table.TableTypeBase} can be used as well.
sap.ui.mdc.table.GridTableType.helpDescription: The table type info class for the metadata-driven table.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.
tooltip.helpDescription: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

sap.ui.mdc.p13n.StateUtil.description: Utility class for state handling of MDC controls. The StateUtil class is offering a generic way to retrieve states and set a desired state for a given MDC control. The StateUtil class is tightly coupled to the SAPUI5 flexibility integration of MDC controls. To use the APIs of Stateutil, the given MDC control instance needs to fully enable all available p13nMode options. This way, Stateutil can create the required changes and retrieve the relevant state of each control.
sap.ui.mdc.p13n.StateUtil.helpDescription: Utility class for state handling of MDC controls. The StateUtil class is offering a generic way to retrieve states and set a desired state for a given MDC control. The StateUtil class is tightly coupled to the SAPUI5 flexibility integration of MDC controls. To use the APIs of Stateutil, the given MDC control instance needs to fully enable all available p13nMode options. This way, Stateutil can create the required changes and retrieve the relevant state of each control.

sap.ui.mdc.Link.description:
A Link control can be used to handle navigation scenarios with one or more targets through direct navigation or by opening a Panel.
It can also be used to display additional content, such as ContactDetails on the Panel. Note: Navigation targets are determined by the implementation of a {@link sap.ui.mdc.LinkDelegate}.
sap.ui.mdc.Link.constructorDescription:
Constructor for the new Link Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEnablePersonalization enablePersonalization} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getDelegate delegate} : object (default: ...see text or source)
  • Associations
    • {@link #getSourceControl sourceControl} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldInfoBase#constructor sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldInfoBase} can be used as well.
sap.ui.mdc.Link.helpDescription:
A Link control can be used to handle navigation scenarios with one or more targets through direct navigation or by opening a Panel.
It can also be used to display additional content, such as ContactDetails on the Panel. Note: Navigation targets are determined by the implementation of a {@link sap.ui.mdc.LinkDelegate}.

sap.ui.mdc.filterbar.vh.CollectiveSearch.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new CollectiveSearchSelect. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
    • {@link #getSelectedItemKey selectedItemKey} : string
    • {@link #get_currentItemText _currentItemText} : string
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.ui.core.Item[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:select select} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.mdc.filterbar.vh.CollectiveSearch.helpDescription: Can be used to manage the CollectiveSearchSelect contro search items.

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

sap.ui.mdc.table.CreationRow.description: Row that allows the user to enter data in a row-shaped form if the {@link sap.ui.mdc.TableType TableType} is "Table". The form elements are aligned with the columns of the table and are created automatically based on the {@link sap.ui.mdc.table.Column#getCreationTemplate creationTemplate} aggregation of the {@link sap.ui.mdc.table.Column}.
sap.ui.mdc.table.CreationRow.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new CreationRow. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getApplyEnabled applyEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getBusy busy} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: true)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:apply apply} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.
sap.ui.mdc.table.CreationRow.helpDescription: Row that allows the user to enter data in a row-shaped form if the {@link sap.ui.mdc.TableType TableType} is "Table". The form elements are aligned with the columns of the table and are created automatically based on the {@link sap.ui.mdc.table.Column#getCreationTemplate creationTemplate} aggregation of the {@link sap.ui.mdc.table.Column}.

sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.Dialog.description: Container for the {@link sap.ui.mdc.ValueHelp ValueHelp} element showing a dialog.
sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.Dialog.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Dialog container. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #get_selectedContentKey _selectedContentKey} : string
    • {@link #get_quickSelectEnabled _quickSelectEnabled} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #get_selectableContents _selectableContents} : object[] (default: [])
    • {@link #getGroupConfig groupConfig} : object (default: {})
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.base.Container#constructor sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.base.Container} can be used as well.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

sap.ui.mdc.field.DefineConditionPanel.description: A DefineConditionPanel control is used inside the ValueHelpPanel control to enter different types of conditions.
sap.ui.mdc.field.DefineConditionPanel.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new DefineConditionPanel. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getConditions conditions} : object[] (default: [])
    • {@link #getFormatOptions formatOptions} : object (default: {})
    • {@link #getLabel label} : string (default: "")
    • {@link #getInputOK inputOK} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
  • Events
    • {@link #event:conditionProcessed conditionProcessed} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.mdc.field.DefineConditionPanel.helpDescription: A DefineConditionPanel control is used inside the ValueHelpPanel control to enter different types of conditions.

_content.description: Optional content that can be rendered. Note: Bind the value-holding property of the control to '$field>/conditions' using sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionsType as type. If the control needs to show multiple conditions, bind its aggregation to '$field>/conditions'. Bind the item controls value-holding property using sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionType as type. Warning: Only controls allowed in a Form are allowed to be used for this optional content. Other controls might break the layout. This means the sap.ui.core.IFormContent interface needs to be implemented by these controls.
