tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldMultiInput.description: The FieldMultiInput control is used to render a multi-input field inside a control based on {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase FieldBase}.
sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldMultiInput.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new FieldMultiInput. The FieldMultiInput control enhances the {@link sap.m.MultiInput MultiInput} control to add ARIA attributes and other {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase FieldBase}-specific logic. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getAriaAttributes ariaAttributes} : object (default: {})
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.MultiInput#constructor sap.m.MultiInput} can be used as well.

suggestionItems.description: Defines the items displayed in the suggestion popup. Changing this aggregation (by calling addSuggestionItem, insertSuggestionItem, removeSuggestionItem, removeAllSuggestionItems, or destroySuggestionItems) after Input is rendered opens/closes the suggestion popup. To display suggestions with two text values, add sap.ui.core.ListItem as SuggestionItems (since 1.21.1). For the selected ListItem, only the first value is returned to the input field. Note: Only text and additionalText property values of the item are displayed. For example, if an icon is set, it is ignored. To display more information per item (including icons), you can use the suggestionRows aggregation. Note: Disabled items are not visualized in the list with the suggestions, however they can still be accessed through the aggregation. Note: If suggestionItems & suggestionRows are set in parallel, the last aggeragtion to come would overwrite the previous ones.

_suggestionPopup.description: The suggestion popup (can be a Dialog or Popover); aggregation needed to also propagate the model and bindings to the content of the popover
_suggestionPopup.helpDescription: The suggestion popup (can be a Dialog or Popover); aggregation needed to also propagate the model and bindings to the content of the popover

dependents.description: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.
dependents.helpDescription: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.

_valueHelpIcon.description: The icon on the right side of the Input
_valueHelpIcon.helpDescription: The icon on the right side of the Input

fieldWidth.description: This property only takes effect if the description property is set. It controls the distribution of space between the input field and the description text. The default value is 50% leaving the other 50% for the description.
fieldWidth.helpDescription: This property only takes effect if the description property is set. It controls the distribution of space between the input field and the description text. The default value is 50% leaving the other 50% for the description.

valueState.description: Visualizes the validation state of the control, e.g. Error, Warning, Success.
valueState.helpDescription: Visualizes the validation state of the control, e.g. Error, Warning, Success.

valueStateText.description: Defines the text that appears in the value state message pop-up. If this is not specified, a default text is shown from the resource bundle.
valueStateText.helpDescription: Defines the text that appears in the value state message pop-up. If this is not specified, a default text is shown from the resource bundle.

dateFormat.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.9.1 sap.m.DatePicker, sap.m.TimePicker or sap.m.DateTimePicker should be used for date/time inputs and formating.
Only used if type=date and no datepicker is available. The data is displayed and the user input is parsed according to this format. Note: The value property is always of the form RFC 3339 (YYYY-MM-dd).
dateFormat.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.9.1 sap.m.DatePicker, sap.m.TimePicker or sap.m.DateTimePicker should be used for date/time inputs and formating.
Only used if type=date and no datepicker is available. The data is displayed and the user input is parsed according to this format. Note: The value property is always of the form RFC 3339 (YYYY-MM-dd).

DeprecatedInfo.description: sap.m.DatePicker, sap.m.TimePicker or sap.m.DateTimePicker should be used for date/time inputs and formating.

objectBindings.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.
busyIndicatorSize.helpDescription: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

showSuggestion.description: If this is set to true, suggest event is fired when user types in the input. Changing the suggestItems aggregation in suggest event listener will show suggestions within a popup. When runs on phone, input will first open a dialog where the input and suggestions are shown. When runs on a tablet, the suggestions are shown in a popup next to the input.
showSuggestion.helpDescription: If this is set to true, suggest event is fired when user types in the input. Changing the suggestItems aggregation in suggest event listener will show suggestions within a popup. When runs on phone, input will first open a dialog where the input and suggestions are shown. When runs on a tablet, the suggestions are shown in a popup next to the input.

enableMultiLineMode.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.58 Replaced with N-more/N-items labels, which work in all cases.
If set to true, the MultiInput will be displayed in multi-line display mode. In multi-line display mode, all tokens can be fully viewed and easily edited in the MultiInput. The default value is false. Note: This property does not take effect on smartphones or when the editable property is set to false. Caution: Do not enable multi-line mode in tables and forms.
enableMultiLineMode.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.58 Replaced with N-more/N-items labels, which work in all cases.
If set to true, the MultiInput will be displayed in multi-line display mode. In multi-line display mode, all tokens can be fully viewed and easily edited in the MultiInput. The default value is false. Note: This property does not take effect on smartphones or when the editable property is set to false. Caution: Do not enable multi-line mode in tables and forms.

DeprecatedInfo.description: Replaced with N-more/N-items labels, which work in all cases.

type.description:
HTML type of the internal input tag (e.g. Text, Number, Email, Phone). The particular effect of this property differs depending on the browser and the current language settings, especially for the type Number.
This parameter is intended to be used with touch devices that use different soft keyboard layouts depending on the given input type.
Only the default value sap.m.InputType.Text may be used in combination with data model formats. sap.ui.model defines extended formats that are mostly incompatible with normal HTML representations for numbers and dates.
type.helpDescription:
HTML type of the internal input tag (e.g. Text, Number, Email, Phone). The particular effect of this property differs depending on the browser and the current language settings, especially for the type Number.
This parameter is intended to be used with touch devices that use different soft keyboard layouts depending on the given input type.
Only the default value sap.m.InputType.Text may be used in combination with data model formats. sap.ui.model defines extended formats that are mostly incompatible with normal HTML representations for numbers and dates.

required.description: Indicates that user input is required. This property is only needed for accessibility purposes when a single relationship between the field and a label (see aggregation labelFor of sap.m.Label) cannot be established (e.g. one label should label multiple fields).
required.helpDescription: Indicates that user input is required. This property is only needed for accessibility purposes when a single relationship between the field and a label (see aggregation labelFor of sap.m.Label) cannot be established (e.g. one label should label multiple fields).

enableSuggestionsHighlighting.description: Specifies whether the suggestions highlighting is enabled.
enableSuggestionsHighlighting.helpDescription: Specifies whether the suggestions highlighting is enabled.

busyIndicatorDelay.description: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.
busyIndicatorDelay.helpDescription: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

maxTokens.description: The max number of tokens that is allowed in MultiInput.
maxTokens.helpDescription: The max number of tokens that is allowed in MultiInput.

valueHelpOnly.description: If set to true, direct text input is disabled and the control will trigger the event "valueHelpRequest" for all user interactions. The properties "showValueHelp", "editable", and "enabled" must be set to true, otherwise the property will have no effect. In this scenario, the showItems API will not work.
valueHelpOnly.helpDescription: If set to true, direct text input is disabled and the control will trigger the event "valueHelpRequest" for all user interactions. The properties "showValueHelp", "editable", and "enabled" must be set to true, otherwise the property will have no effect. In this scenario, the showItems API will not work.

id.description: Unique ID of this instance. If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework. AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for Ids that the application (or other code) creates. It can be configured option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link sap.ui.core.Configuration}.

startSuggestion.description: Minimum length of the entered text in input before suggest event is fired. The default value is 1 which means the suggest event is fired after user types in input. Note: When it's set to 0, suggest event is fired when input with no text gets focus. In this case no suggestion popup will open.
startSuggestion.helpDescription: Minimum length of the entered text in input before suggest event is fired. The default value is 1 which means the suggest event is fired after user types in input. Note: When it's set to 0, suggest event is fired when input with no text gets focus. In this case no suggestion popup will open.

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

visible.description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.
visible.helpDescription: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.

textAlign.description: Defines the horizontal alignment of the text that is shown inside the input field.
textAlign.helpDescription: Defines the horizontal alignment of the text that is shown inside the input field.

ariaAttributes.description: Sets the ARIA attributes added to the MultiInput control. The object contains ARIA attributes in an aria node. Additional attributes, such as role, autocomplete or valueHelpEnabled, are added on root level.
ariaAttributes.helpDescription: Sets the ARIA attributes added to the MultiInput control. The object contains ARIA attributes in an aria node. Additional attributes, such as role, autocomplete or valueHelpEnabled, are added on root level.

suggestionRowValidator.description: Defines the validation callback function called when a suggestion row gets selected.
suggestionRowValidator.helpDescription: Defines the validation callback function called when a suggestion row gets selected.

separateSuggestions.description: Specifies whether to display separators in tabular suggestions.
separateSuggestions.helpDescription: Specifies whether to display separators in tabular suggestions.

name.description: The name to be used in the HTML code (for example, for HTML forms that send data to the server via submission).
name.helpDescription: The name to be used in the HTML code (for example, for HTML forms that send data to the server via submission).

maxSuggestionWidth.description: If set, the value of this parameter will control the horizontal size of the suggestion list to display more data. This allows suggestion lists to be wider than the input field if there is enough space available. By default, the suggestion list is always as wide as the input field. Note: The value will be ignored if the actual width of the input field is larger than the specified parameter value.
maxSuggestionWidth.helpDescription: If set, the value of this parameter will control the horizontal size of the suggestion list to display more data. This allows suggestion lists to be wider than the input field if there is enough space available. By default, the suggestion list is always as wide as the input field. Note: The value will be ignored if the actual width of the input field is larger than the specified parameter value.

maxLength.description: Maximum number of characters. Value '0' means the feature is switched off. This parameter is not compatible with the input type sap.m.InputType.Number. If the input type is set to Number, the maxLength value is ignored.
maxLength.helpDescription: Maximum number of characters. Value '0' means the feature is switched off. This parameter is not compatible with the input type sap.m.InputType.Number. If the input type is set to Number, the maxLength value is ignored.

textFormatter.helpDescription: Defines the display text formatter function.

showValueHelp.helpDescription: If set to true, a value help indicator will be displayed inside the control. When clicked the event "valueHelpRequest" will be fired.

description.description: The description is a text after the input field, e.g. units of measurement, currencies.
description.helpDescription: The description is a text after the input field, e.g. units of measurement, currencies.

enabled.description: Indicates whether the user can interact with the control or not. Note: Disabled controls cannot be focused and they are out of the tab-chain.
enabled.helpDescription: Indicates whether the user can interact with the control or not. Note: Disabled controls cannot be focused and they are out of the tab-chain.

textDirection.helpDescription: Defines the text directionality of the input field, e.g. RTL, LTR

Deprecated! Since 1.69 The blocked property is deprecated. There is no accessibility support for this property. Blocked controls should not be used inside Controls, which rely on keyboard navigation, e.g. List controls.
Whether the control is currently in blocked state.

Deprecated! Since 1.69 The blocked property is deprecated. There is no accessibility support for this property. Blocked controls should not be used inside Controls, which rely on keyboard navigation, e.g. List controls.

busy.description: Whether the control is currently in busy state.
busy.helpDescription: Whether the control is currently in busy state.

fieldGroupIds.description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is fired. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

showTableSuggestionValueHelp.description: For tabular suggestions, this flag will show/hide the button at the end of the suggestion table that triggers the event "valueHelpRequest" when pressed. The default value is true. Note: If suggestions are not tabular or no suggestions are used, the button will not be displayed and this flag is without effect.

effectiveShowClearIcon.helpDescription: Specifies whether the clear icon should be shown/hidden on user interaction.

valueLiveUpdate.description: Indicates when the value gets updated with the user changes: At each keystroke (true) or first when the user presses enter or tabs out (false). Note: When set to true and the value of the Input control is bound to a model, the change event becomes obsolete and will not be fired, as the value in the model will be updated each time the user provides input. In such cases, subscription to the liveChange event is more appropriate, as it corresponds to the way the underlying model gets updated.

Note: When set to true and the value of the Input control is bound to a model, the change event becomes obsolete and will not be fired, as the value in the model will be updated each time the user provides input. submit.name: submit
submit.description:
This event is fired when user presses the Enter key on the input. Notes:
  • The event is fired independent of whether there was a change before or not. If a change was performed, the event is fired after the change event.
  • The event is also fired when an item of the select list is selected via Enter.
  • The event is only fired on an input which allows text input (editable, enabled and not valueHelpOnly).
submit.helpDescription:
This event is fired when user presses the Enter key on the input. Notes:
  • The event is fired independent of whether there was a change before or not. If a change was performed, the event is fired after the change event.

  • The event is only fired on an input which allows text input (editable, enabled and not valueHelpOnly).

sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldValueHelpContentWr.description: Base type for FieldValueHelp content control wrapper.
sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldValueHelpContentWr.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new FieldValueHelpContentWrapperBase. The FieldValueHelp element supports different types of content. To map the content control API to the FieldValueHelp element, a wrapper is needed. This base class just defines the API. Note: All events and functions must only be used by the corresponding field help. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getSelectedItems selectedItems} : object[] (default: []) (default)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:navigate navigate} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:selectionChange selectionChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:dataUpdate dataUpdate} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.
sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldValueHelpContentWr.helpDescription: Base type for FieldValueHelp content control wrapper.

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.
tooltip.helpDescription: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldValueHelpMdcTableW.description: Wrapper to use a sap.m.Table control as content of a FieldValueHelp element
sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldValueHelpMdcTableW.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new FieldValueHelpMdcTableWrapper. The FieldValueHelp element supports different types of content. This is a wrapper to use a sap.ui.mdc.Table control as content. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getTable table} : sap.ui.mdc.Table (default)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldValueHelpTableWrapperBase#constructor sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldValueHelpTableWrapperBase} can be used as well.
sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldValueHelpMdcTableW.helpDescription: Wrapper to use a sap.m.Table control as content of a FieldValueHelp element

sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.base.FilterableList.description: Content for the {@link sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.base.Container Container} element.
sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.base.FilterableList.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new FilterableListContent. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getFilterFields filterFields} : string (default: "")
    • {@link #getKeyPath keyPath} : string (default: "")
    • {@link #getDescriptionPath descriptionPath} : string (default: "")
    • {@link #getGroup group} : string (default: "")
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getFilterBar filterBar} : sap.ui.mdc.filterbar.vh.FilterBar
  • Associations
    • {@link #getFilters filters} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.mdc.IFilter)[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.base.ListContent#constructor sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.base.ListContent} can be used as well.
sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.base.FilterableList.helpDescription: Content for the {@link sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.base.Container Container} element.

filterFields.description: The fields based on which the table data is filtered. For filtering the value of the filterValue property is used. If set to $search and the used binding supports search requests, a $search request is used for filtering. If set to one or more properties, the filters for these properties are used for filtering. These filters are set on the ListBinding used. The properties need to be separated by commas and enclosed by "*" characters. ("*Property1,Property2*") If it is empty, no suggestion is available.

filterFields.description: The fields based on which the table data is filtered. For filtering the value of the filterValue property is used. If set to $search and the used binding supports search requests, a $search request is used for filtering. If set to one or more properties, the filters for these properties are used for filtering. These filters are set on the ListBinding used. The properties need to be separated by commas and enclosed by "*" characters. ("*Property1,Property2*") If it is empty, no suggestion is available.

sap.ui.mdc.field.MultiValueFieldItem.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new MultiValueFieldItem. The MultiValueField control holds its values as items. The MultiValueFieldItem element defines these items. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getKey key} : any (default)
    • {@link #getDescription description} : string
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.content.FixedList.description: Content for the {@link sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.base.Container Container} element showing a list with fix values.
sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.content.FixedList.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new FixedList content. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getGroupable groupable} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getFilterList filterList} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.ui.mdc.field.ListFieldHelpItem[] (default)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.base.ListContent#constructor sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.base.ListContent} can be used as well.
sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.content.FixedList.helpDescription: Content for the {@link sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.base.Container Container} element showing a list with fix values.

These modules are not to be used stand-alone.

These modules are not to be used stand-alone.

sap.ui.mdc.Control.description: The base class for MDC controls providing delegate-related functionality (see {@link sap.ui.mdc.mixin.DelegateMixin}).
sap.ui.mdc.Control.constructorDescription:
Creates and initializes a new MDC control with the given sId and settings. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getDelegate delegate} : object
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.mdc.Control.helpDescription: The base class for MDC controls providing delegate-related functionality (see {@link sap.ui.mdc.mixin.DelegateMixin}).

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. Path to the Delegate module that provides the required APIs to execute model-specific logic.
Note: Ensure that the related file can be requested (any required library has to be loaded before that).
Do not bind or modify the module. This property can only be configured during control initialization.

Path to the Delegate module that provides the required APIs to execute model-specific logic.
Note: Ensure that the related file can be requested (any required library has to be loaded before that).
Do not bind or modify the module. This property can only be configured during control initialization.

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

visible.description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.
visible.helpDescription: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.

Deprecated! Since 1.69 The blocked property is deprecated. There is no accessibility support for this property. Blocked controls should not be used inside Controls, which rely on keyboard navigation, e.g. List controls.
Whether the control is currently in blocked state.

busyIndicatorDelay.helpDescription: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

fieldGroupIds.description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is fired. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldHelpBase.description: Base type for the FieldHelp association in the FieldBase controls.
sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldHelpBase.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new FieldHelpBase. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getConditions conditions} : object[] (default: [])
    • {@link #getDelegate delegate} : object (default: ...see text or source)
    • {@link #getFilterValue filterValue} : string (default: "") (default)
    • {@link #getValidateInput validateInput} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
  • Events
    • {@link #event:select select} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:navigate navigate} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:dataUpdate dataUpdate} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:disconnect disconnect} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:open open} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:afterClose afterClose} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:switchToValueHelp switchToValueHelp} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.mdc.Element#constructor sap.ui.mdc.Element} can be used as well.
sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldHelpBase.helpDescription: Base type for the FieldHelp association in the FieldBase controls.

filterValue.description: The value by which the help is filtered. Note: This only takes effect if the FieldHelp element supports filtering. Note: This property must only be set by the control the FieldHelp element belongs to, not by the application.
filterValue.helpDescription: The value by which the help is filtered. Note: This only takes effect if the FieldHelp element supports filtering. Note: This property must only be set by the control the FieldHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

validateInput.description:
If this property is set, the user input is validated against the field help. If no entry is found for the user input, an error occurs.

If this property is not set, the user input is still checked against the field help. But if no entry is found, the user input is set to the field if the used data type allows this. (A type parsing error is shown if the user input adheres to the requirements of the used data type.)

layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

sap.ui.mdc.filterbar.FilterBarBase.description: The FilterBarBase control is used as a faceless base class for common functionality of any MDC FilterBar derivation.
sap.ui.mdc.filterbar.FilterBarBase.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new FilterBarBase. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getDelegate delegate} : object (default: ...see text or source)
    • {@link #getLiveMode liveMode} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowMessages showMessages} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowGoButton showGoButton} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getFilterConditions filterConditions} : object (default: {})
    • {@link #getPropertyInfo propertyInfo} : object (default: [])
    • {@link #getSuspendSelection suspendSelection} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #get_filterCount _filterCount} : string
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getFilterItems filterItems} : sap.ui.mdc.FilterField[] (default)
    • {@link #getBasicSearchField basicSearchField} : sap.ui.mdc.FilterField
  • Associations
    • {@link #getVariantBackreference variantBackreference} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantManagement)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:search search} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:filtersChanged filtersChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.mdc.Control#constructor sap.ui.mdc.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.mdc.filterbar.FilterBarBase.helpDescription: The FilterBarBase control is used as a faceless base class for common functionality of any MDC FilterBar derivation.

sap.ui.mdc.Chart.description: The Chart control creates a chart based on metadata and the configuration specified.
sap.ui.mdc.Chart.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Chart. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: "100%")
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: "100%")
    • {@link #getDelegate delegate} : object (default: ...see text or source)
    • {@link #getHeader header} : string
    • {@link #getNoDataText noDataText} : string (default: "No data")
    • {@link #getP13nMode p13nMode} : sap.ui.mdc.ChartP13nMode[] (default: [])
    • {@link #getLegendVisible legendVisible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getIgnoreToolbarActions ignoreToolbarActions} : sap.ui.mdc.ChartToolbarActionType[] (default: [])
    • {@link #getMinWidth minWidth} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: "240px")
    • {@link #getMinHeight minHeight} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: "400px")
    • {@link #getSortConditions sortConditions} : object
    • {@link #getFilterConditions filterConditions} : object (default: {})
    • {@link #getShowChartTooltip showChartTooltip} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getAutoBindOnInit autoBindOnInit} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getChartType chartType} : string (default: "column")
    • {@link #getShowSelectionDetails showSelectionDetails} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getPropertyInfo propertyInfo} : object (default: [])
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.ui.mdc.chart.Item[] (default)
    • {@link #getActions actions} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getSelectionDetailsActions selectionDetailsActions} : sap.ui.mdc.chart.SelectionDetailsActions
    • {@link #getVariant variant} : sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantManagement
  • Associations
    • {@link #getFilter filter} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.mdc.IFilter)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:selectionDetailsActionPressed selectionDetailsActionPressed} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:innerChartLoadedData innerChartLoadedData} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.mdc.Control#constructor sap.ui.mdc.Control} can be used as well.

sap.ui.mdc.ActionToolbar.description: The column for the metadata driven table, that hold the template to be shown when the rows has data.
sap.ui.mdc.ActionToolbar.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ActionToolbar.
Note:
The control is experimental and the API / behavior is not finalized. It should only be used internally in other mdc controls (e.g. chart/table).
The content aggregation of the control must not be used. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getUseAsHeader useAsHeader} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getBegin begin} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getBetween between} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getActions actions} : sap.ui.mdc.actiontoolbar.ActionToolbarAction[] (default)
    • {@link #getEnd end} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.OverflowToolbar#constructor sap.m.OverflowToolbar} can be used as well.
sap.ui.mdc.ActionToolbar.helpDescription: The column for the metadata driven table, that hold the template to be shown when the rows has data.

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

ariaHasPopup.description:
Defines the aria-haspopup attribute of the Toolbar. if the active design is true. Guidance for choosing appropriate value:
  • We recommend that you use the {@link sap.ui.core.aria.HasPopup} enumeration.
  • If you use controls based on sap.m.Popover or sap.m.Dialog, then you must use AriaHasPopup.Dialog (both sap.m.Popover and sap.m.Dialog have role "dialog" assigned internally).
  • If you use other controls, or directly sap.ui.core.Popup, you need to check the container role/type and map the value of ariaHasPopup accordingly.

  • If you use other controls, or directly sap.ui.core.Popup, you need to check the container role/type and map the value of ariaHasPopup accordingly.

asyncMode.description: Defines whether the OverflowToolbar works in async mode. Note: When this property is set to true, the OverflowToolbar makes its layout recalculations asynchronously. sap.ui.mdc.Table.description: A metadata-driven table to simplify the usage of existing tables, such as the ResponsiveTable and GridTable controls. The metadata needs to be provided via the {@link module:sap/ui/mdc/TableDelegate TableDelegate} implementation as {@link sap.ui.mdc.table.PropertyInfo}.
sap.ui.mdc.Table.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new MDCTable. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getP13nMode p13nMode} : sap.ui.mdc.TableP13nMode[] (default: [])
    • {@link #getDelegate delegate} : object (default: ...see text or source)
    • {@link #getHeaderLevel headerLevel} : sap.ui.core.TitleLevel (default: Auto)
    • {@link #getAutoBindOnInit autoBindOnInit} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getHeader header} : string
    • {@link #getHeaderVisible headerVisible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getSelectionMode selectionMode} : sap.ui.mdc.SelectionMode (default: None)
    • {@link #getShowRowCount showRowCount} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getThreshold threshold} : int (default: -1)
    • {@link #getNoDataText noDataText} : string
    • {@link #getSortConditions sortConditions} : object
    • {@link #getFilterConditions filterConditions} : object (default: {})
    • {@link #getGroupConditions groupConditions} : object
    • {@link #getAggregateConditions aggregateConditions} : object
    • {@link #getEnableExport enableExport} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getBusyIndicatorDelay busyIndicatorDelay} : int (default: 100)
    • {@link #getEnableColumnResize enableColumnResize} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowPasteButton showPasteButton} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEnablePaste enablePaste} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getMultiSelectMode multiSelectMode} : sap.ui.mdc.MultiSelectMode (default: Default)
    • {@link #getEnableAutoColumnWidth enableAutoColumnWidth} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getType type} : sap.ui.mdc.table.TableTypeBase|sap.ui.mdc.TableType
    • {@link #getColumns columns} : sap.ui.mdc.table.Column[] (default)
    • {@link #getCreationRow creationRow} : sap.ui.mdc.table.CreationRow
    • {@link #getActions actions} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getVariant variant} : sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantManagement
    • {@link #getQuickFilter quickFilter} : sap.ui.core.Control
    • {@link #getRowSettings rowSettings} : sap.ui.mdc.table.RowSettings
    • {@link #getDataStateIndicator dataStateIndicator} : sap.m.plugins.DataStateIndicator
  • Associations
    • {@link #getFilter filter} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.mdc.IFilter)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:rowPress rowPress} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:selectionChange selectionChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:beforeExport beforeExport} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:paste paste} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.mdc.Control#constructor sap.ui.mdc.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.mdc.Table.helpDescription: A metadata-driven table to simplify the usage of existing tables, such as the ResponsiveTable and GridTable controls. The metadata needs to be provided via the {@link module:sap/ui/mdc/TableDelegate TableDelegate} implementation as {@link sap.ui.mdc.table.PropertyInfo}.

dataStateIndicator.description: DataStateIndicator plugin that can be used to show binding-related messages. Note: The message filtering is not yet supported for this control. Therefore the {@link sap.m.plugins.DataStateIndicator#getEnableFiltering enableFiltering} property of the DataStateIndicator plugin must not be set to true.
dataStateIndicator.helpDescription: DataStateIndicator plugin that can be used to show binding-related messages. Note: The message filtering is not yet supported for this control. Therefore the {@link sap.m.plugins.DataStateIndicator#getEnableFiltering enableFiltering} property of the DataStateIndicator plugin must not be set to true.

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

rowSettings.description: Settings for the table rows. Note: Each time the properties of the settings are changed, they have to be applied again via setRowSettings for the changes to take effect.
rowSettings.helpDescription: Settings for the table rows. Note: Each time the properties of the settings are changed, they have to be applied again via setRowSettings for the changes to take effect.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

threshold.description:
Number of records to be requested from the model. If the type property is set to ResponsiveTable, then it refers to the {@link sap.m.ListBase#getGrowingThreshold growingThreshold} property of ResponsiveTable. If the type property is set to Table, then it refers to the {@link sap.ui.table.Table#getThreshold threshold} property of GridTable.
Note: This property only takes effect if it is set to a positive integer value. Otherwise the table uses the default value of the corresponding table types.
threshold.helpDescription:
Number of records to be requested from the model. If the type property is set to ResponsiveTable, then it refers to the {@link sap.m.ListBase#getGrowingThreshold growingThreshold} property of ResponsiveTable. If the type property is set to Table, then it refers to the {@link sap.ui.table.Table#getThreshold threshold} property of GridTable.
Note: This property only takes effect if it is set to a positive integer value. Otherwise the table uses the default value of the corresponding table types.

delegate.description:

fieldGroupIds.description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

enableAutoColumnWidth.description: Enables automatic column width calculation based on metadata information if set to true. The column width calculation takes the type, column label, referenced properties, and many other metadata parameters into account. Providing a more precise maxLength value for the String type or precision value for numeric types can help this algorithm to produce better results. The calculated column widths can have a minimum of 3rem and a maximum of 20rem. Note: To customize the automatic column width calculation, the visualSettings.widthSettings key of the PropertyInfo can be used. To avoid the heuristic column width calculation for a particular column, the visualSettings.widthSettings key of the PropertyInfo must be set to null. This feature has no effect if the width property of the column is bound or its value is set.
enableAutoColumnWidth.helpDescription: Enables automatic column width calculation based on metadata information if set to true. The column width calculation takes the type, column label, referenced properties, and many other metadata parameters into account. Providing a more precise maxLength value for the String type or precision value for numeric types can help this algorithm to produce better results. The calculated column widths can have a minimum of 3rem and a maximum of 20rem. Note: To customize the automatic column width calculation, the visualSettings.widthSettings key of the PropertyInfo can be used. To avoid the heuristic column width calculation for a particular column, the visualSettings.widthSettings key of the PropertyInfo must be set to null. This feature has no effect if the width property of the column is bound or its value is set.

showRowCount.description:
Determines whether the number of rows is shown along with the header text. If set to false, the number of rows is not shown on the user interface.
Note:
For better performance dedicated OData requests should not be sent. The count mode must be configured either in the model or in the binding of the table.
This property can only be used if the back-end service supports row count.

sap.ui.mdc.field.CustomFieldHelp.description: A field help used in the FieldHelp association in FieldBase controls that allows you to add custom content.
sap.ui.mdc.field.CustomFieldHelp.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new CustomFieldHelp. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control (default)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:beforeOpen beforeOpen} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldHelpBase#constructor sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldHelpBase} can be used as well.
sap.ui.mdc.field.CustomFieldHelp.helpDescription: A field help used in the FieldHelp association in FieldBase controls that allows you to add custom content.

filterValue.helpDescription: The value by which the help is filtered. Note: This only takes effect if the FieldHelp element supports filtering. Note: This property must only be set by the control the FieldHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

validateInput.description:
If this property is set, the user input is validated against the field help. If no entry is found for the user input, an error occurs.

If this property is not set, the user input is still checked against the field help. But if no entry is found, the user input is set to the field if the used data type allows this. (A type parsing error is shown if the user input adheres to the requirements of the used data type.)
validateInput.helpDescription:

If this property is not set, the user input is still checked against the field help. But if no entry is found, the user input is set to the field if the used data type allows this. (A type parsing error is shown if the user input adheres to the requirements of the used data type.)

AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for Ids that the application (or other code) creates. It can be configured option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link sap.ui.core.Configuration}.

sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.base.Container.description: Container for the {@link sap.ui.mdc.ValueHelp ValueHelp} element.
sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.base.Container.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Container. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string (default: "")
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.base.Content[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:select select} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:confirm confirm} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:opened opened} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:closed closed} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:cancel cancel} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:requestDelegateContent requestDelegateContent} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:requestSwitchToDialog requestSwitchToDialog} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:navigated navigated} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.
sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.base.Container.helpDescription: Container for the {@link sap.ui.mdc.ValueHelp ValueHelp} element.

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

sap.ui.mdc.field.TokenDisplay.description: The TokenDisplay control is used to render a field inside a control based on {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase FieldBase}.
sap.ui.mdc.field.TokenDisplay.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new TokenDisplay. The TokenDisplay control enhances the {@link sap.m.Token Token} control to add ARIA attributes and other {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase FieldBase}-specific logic. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #get_delimiter _delimiter} : string (default: "·")
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.Token#constructor sap.m.Token} can be used as well.
sap.ui.mdc.field.TokenDisplay.helpDescription: The TokenDisplay control is used to render a field inside a control based on {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase FieldBase}.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

ariaLabelledBy.description: Association to controls / IDs that label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).
ariaLabelledBy.helpDescription: Association to controls / IDs that label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

fieldHelp.description: Optional FieldHelp. This is an association that allows the usage of one FieldHelp instance for multiple fields. Note: If the field is inside of a table, do not set the FieldHelp instance as dependent to the field. If you do every field instance in every table row gets a clone of it. Put the FieldHelp instance e.g. as dependent on the table or page. The FieldHelp instance must be somewhere in the control tree, otherwise there might be rendering or update issues. Note: For Boolean fields, no FieldHelp should be added, but a default FieldHelp used instead.
fieldHelp.helpDescription: Optional FieldHelp. This is an association that allows the usage of one FieldHelp instance for multiple fields. Note: If the field is inside of a table, do not set the FieldHelp instance as dependent to the field. If you do every field instance in every table row gets a clone of it. Put the FieldHelp instance e.g. as dependent on the table or page. The FieldHelp instance must be somewhere in the control tree, otherwise there might be rendering or update issues. Note: For Boolean fields, no FieldHelp should be added, but a default FieldHelp used instead.

sap.ui.mdc.Field.description: The Field control is used to bind its value to data of a certain data type. Based on the data type settings, a default control is rendered by the Field. For example, if a date type is used, a {@link sap.m.DatePicker DatePicker} is rendered.
sap.ui.mdc.Field.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Field. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getValue value} : any (default)
    • {@link #getAdditionalValue additionalValue} : any
  • Events
    • {@link #event:change change} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase#constructor sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase} can be used as well.
sap.ui.mdc.Field.helpDescription: The Field control is used to bind its value to data of a certain data type. Based on the data type settings, a default control is rendered by the Field. For example, if a date type is used, a {@link sap.m.DatePicker DatePicker} is rendered.

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

contentEdit.description: Optional content to be rendered if the editMode property is not set to Display. Note: If a control is assigned to the content aggregation, this one is ignored. Note: Bind the value-holding property of the control to '$field>/conditions' using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionsType ConditionsType} as type. If the control needs to show multiple conditions, bind its aggregation to '$field>/conditions'. Bind the item controls value-holding property using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionType ConditionType} as type. Warning: Only controls allowed in a {@link sap.ui.layout.form.Form Form} are allowed to be used for this optional content. Other controls might break the layout. This means the {@link sap.ui.core.IFormContent IFormContent} interface needs to be implemented by these controls.
contentEdit.helpDescription: Optional content to be rendered if the editMode property is not set to Display. Note: If a control is assigned to the content aggregation, this one is ignored. Note: Bind the value-holding property of the control to '$field>/conditions' using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionsType ConditionsType} as type. If the control needs to show multiple conditions, bind its aggregation to '$field>/conditions'. Bind the item controls value-holding property using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionType ConditionType} as type. Warning: Only controls allowed in a {@link sap.ui.layout.form.Form Form} are allowed to be used for this optional content. Other controls might break the layout. This means the {@link sap.ui.core.IFormContent IFormContent} interface needs to be implemented by these controls.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

fieldGroupIds.description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is fired. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

placeholder.description: Defines a short hint intended to aid the user with data entry when the control has no value. If the value is null no placeholder is shown. Note: If the rendered control doesn't support this feature, this property is ignored.

AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for Ids that the application (or other code) creates. It can be configured option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link sap.ui.core.Configuration}.

value.helpDescription: The value of the field. To display the key and the description in one field, the key must be set on the value property.

multipleLines.description: If set, the Field is rendered using a multi-line control. This property only affects types that support multiple lines. This property is only used for single-value fields. Note If the data type used doesn't support multiple lines an error is thrown.

The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.
