ariaLabelledBy.description: Association to controls / IDs that label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).
ariaLabelledBy.helpDescription: Association to controls / IDs that label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

fieldHelp.description: Optional FieldHelp. This is an association that allows the usage of one FieldHelp instance for multiple fields. Note: If the field is inside of a table, do not set the FieldHelp instance as dependent to the field. If you do every field instance in every table row gets a clone of it. Put the FieldHelp instance e.g. as dependent on the table or page. The FieldHelp instance must be somewhere in the control tree, otherwise there might be rendering or update issues. Note: For Boolean fields, no FieldHelp should be added, but a default FieldHelp used instead.
fieldHelp.helpDescription: Optional FieldHelp. This is an association that allows the usage of one FieldHelp instance for multiple fields. Note: If the field is inside of a table, do not set the FieldHelp instance as dependent to the field. If you do every field instance in every table row gets a clone of it. Put the FieldHelp instance e.g. as dependent on the table or page. The FieldHelp instance must be somewhere in the control tree, otherwise there might be rendering or update issues. Note: For Boolean fields, no FieldHelp should be added, but a default FieldHelp used instead.

sap.ui.mdc.MultiValueField.description: A MultiValueField control can hold multiple values. The values are stored as items. A MultiValueField control can be used to bind its items to data of a certain data type. Based on the data type settings, a default control is rendered by the MultiValueField control.
sap.ui.mdc.MultiValueField.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new MultiValueField control. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getDelegate delegate} : object (default: ...see text or source)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.ui.mdc.field.MultiValueFieldItem[] (default)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:change change} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase#constructor sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase} can be used as well.
sap.ui.mdc.MultiValueField.helpDescription: A MultiValueField control can hold multiple values. The values are stored as items. A MultiValueField control can be used to bind its items to data of a certain data type. Based on the data type settings, a default control is rendered by the MultiValueField control.

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

contentEdit.description: Optional content to be rendered if the editMode property is not set to Display. Note: If a control is assigned to the content aggregation, this one is ignored. Note: Bind the value-holding property of the control to '$field>/conditions' using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionsType ConditionsType} as type. If the control needs to show multiple conditions, bind its aggregation to '$field>/conditions'. Bind the item controls value-holding property using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionType ConditionType} as type. Warning: Only controls allowed in a {@link sap.ui.layout.form.Form Form} are allowed to be used for this optional content. Other controls might break the layout. This means the {@link sap.ui.core.IFormContent IFormContent} interface needs to be implemented by these controls.
contentEdit.helpDescription: Optional content to be rendered if the editMode property is not set to Display. Note: If a control is assigned to the content aggregation, this one is ignored. Note: Bind the value-holding property of the control to '$field>/conditions' using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionsType ConditionsType} as type. If the control needs to show multiple conditions, bind its aggregation to '$field>/conditions'. Bind the item controls value-holding property using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionType ConditionType} as type. Warning: Only controls allowed in a {@link sap.ui.layout.form.Form Form} are allowed to be used for this optional content. Other controls might break the layout. This means the {@link sap.ui.core.IFormContent IFormContent} interface needs to be implemented by these controls.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.
tooltip.helpDescription: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

If a control is set (using content, contentEdit, or contentDisplay), this control needs to support the valueState behavior, otherwise valueState is not visualized.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

delegate.description:
Path to the MultiValueFieldDelegate module that provides the required APIs to execute model-specific logic.
Note: Ensure that the related file can be requested (any required library has to be loaded before that).
Do not bind or modify the module. Once the required module is associated, this property might not be needed any longer.

fieldGroupIds.description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is fired. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

placeholder.description: Defines a short hint intended to aid the user with data entry when the control has no value. If the value is null no placeholder is shown. Note: If the rendered control doesn't support this feature, this property is ignored.
placeholder.helpDescription: Defines a short hint intended to aid the user with data entry when the control has no value. If the value is null no placeholder is shown. Note: If the rendered control doesn't support this feature, this property is ignored.

id.description: Unique ID of this instance. If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework. AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for Ids that the application (or other code) creates. It can be configured option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link sap.ui.core.Configuration}.

maxConditions.description: Sets the maximum amount of conditions that are allowed for this field. The default value of -1 indicates that an unlimited amount of conditions can be defined. Note If the data type used doesn't support multiple conditions, an error is thrown.
maxConditions.helpDescription: Sets the maximum amount of conditions that are allowed for this field. The default value of -1 indicates that an unlimited amount of conditions can be defined. Note If the data type used doesn't support multiple conditions, an error is thrown.

bindingContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

multipleLines.description: If set, the Field is rendered using a multi-line control. This property only affects types that support multiple lines. This property is only used for single-value fields. Note If the data type used doesn't support multiple lines an error is thrown.
multipleLines.helpDescription: If set, the Field is rendered using a multi-line control. This property only affects types that support multiple lines. This property is only used for single-value fields. Note If the data type used doesn't support multiple lines an error is thrown.

visible.description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.

If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). dataTypeFormatOptions.helpDescription: The format options of the type specified in dataType.

dataTypeConstraints.helpDescription: The constraints of the type specified in dataType.

dataType.helpDescription: The type of data handled by the field. This type is used to parse, format, and validate the value.

metadataContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected. The special setting is only for internal use.

showEmptyIndicator.description: If set, an empty Field renders an empty-indicator in display mode. This property only takes effect if editMode is set to Display. Note Empty means the Field holds no value. If an empty string is a valid value, the Field might show nothing, depending on the display settings and assigned description or FieldHelp.

Note Empty means the Field holds no value. If an empty string is a valid value, the Field might show nothing, depending on the display settings and assigned description or FieldHelp.

editMode.helpDescription: Determines whether the field is editable, read-only, or disabled.

width.description: Defines the width of the control.
width.helpDescription: Defines the width of the control.

conditions.description:
Sets the conditions that represent the values of the field. This should be bound to a {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel} using the corresponding fieldPath. Note: For {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} controls, the conditions property must be used to bind {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} to a {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel}.
For example, for a {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} control inside a {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar FilterBar} control the binding looks like this:
conditions="{$filters>/conditions/propertyPath}" with the following data:
  • $filters as the name of the condition model
  • /conditions/ as a required static part of the binding
  • propertyPath as the property name
For an Any (see {@link sap.ui.model.FilterOperator}) {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} control, the binding looks like this:
conditions='{$filters>/conditions/navPath*/propertyPath}' with the following data:
  • $filters as the name of the condition model
  • /conditions/ as a required static part of the binding
  • navPath#42;/ as the navigation property name
  • propertyPath as the property name
Between navPath and propertyPath, */ is required. Note: A condition must have the structure of {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionObject ConditionObject}.
conditions.helpDescription:
Sets the conditions that represent the values of the field. This should be bound to a {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel} using the corresponding fieldPath. Note: For {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} controls, the conditions property must be used to bind {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} to a {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel}.
For example, for a {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} control inside a {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar FilterBar} control the binding looks like this:
conditions="{$filters>/conditions/propertyPath}" with the following data:
  • $filters as the name of the condition model
  • /conditions/ as a required static part of the binding
  • propertyPath as the property name
For an Any (see {@link sap.ui.model.FilterOperator}) {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} control, the binding looks like this:
conditions='{$filters>/conditions/navPath*/propertyPath}' with the following data:
  • $filters as the name of the condition model
  • /conditions/ as a required static part of the binding
  • navPath#42;/ as the navigation property name
  • propertyPath as the property name
Between navPath and propertyPath, */ is required. Note: A condition must have the structure of {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionObject ConditionObject}.

sap.ui.mdc.field.TokenizerDisplay.description: The TokenizerDisplay control is used to render a Tokenizer inside a control based on {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase FieldBase}.
sap.ui.mdc.field.TokenizerDisplay.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new TokenizerDisplay. The TokenizerDisplay control enhances the {@link sap.m.Tokenizer Tokenizer} control to support diaply only tokens. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEmptyIndicatorMode emptyIndicatorMode} : sap.m.EmptyIndicatorMode (default: Off)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.Tokenizer#constructor sap.m.Tokenizer} can be used as well.
sap.ui.mdc.field.TokenizerDisplay.helpDescription: The TokenizerDisplay control is used to render a Tokenizer inside a control based on {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase FieldBase}.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

objectBindings.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

caseSensitive.description: If this property is set to true, the filtering for user input is always case-sensitive. Otherwise user input is checked case-insensitively. If $search is used, this property has no effect on the $search request. If the used back-end service supports a case-insensitive search, set this property to false.
caseSensitive.helpDescription: If this property is set to true, the filtering for user input is always case-sensitive. Otherwise user input is checked case-insensitively. If $search is used, this property has no effect on the $search request. If the used back-end service supports a case-insensitive search, set this property to false.

tokenizerTitle.description: Title text that appears in the dialog tokenizer panel, when ony one content exist.
tokenizerTitle.helpDescription: Title text that appears in the dialog tokenizer panel, when ony one content exist.

shortTitle.description: Title text that appears in the dialog header.
shortTitle.helpDescription: Title text that appears in the dialog header.

title.description: Title text that appears tab header.
title.helpDescription: Title text that appears tab header.

metadataContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected. The special setting is only for internal use.

filterValue.description: Value for filtering ($search) Note: This property must not be set from outside, it is only to be used by the corresponding container
filterValue.helpDescription: Value for filtering ($search) Note: This property must not be set from outside, it is only to be used by the corresponding container

id.description: Unique ID of this instance. If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework. AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for Ids that the application (or other code) creates. It can be configured option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link sap.ui.core.Configuration}.

conditions.description: Conditions of the value help Note: This property must not be set from outside, it is only to be used by the corresponding container
conditions.helpDescription: Conditions of the value help Note: This property must not be set from outside, it is only to be used by the corresponding container

config.description: internal configuration Note: This property must not be set from outside, it is only to be used by the corresponding container
config.helpDescription: internal configuration Note: This property must not be set from outside, it is only to be used by the corresponding container

useAsValueHelp.description: If set, the List is also opened if the ValueHelp icon is pressed.
useAsValueHelp.helpDescription: If set, the List is also opened if the ValueHelp icon is pressed.

bindingContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

formatError.name: formatError
formatError.description: Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated from the model, but formatting the value failed with an exception.
formatError.helpDescription: Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated from the model, but formatting the value failed with an exception.
formatError.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

confirm.name: confirm
confirm.description: Fired if a change on the content is confirmed
confirm.helpDescription: Fired if a change on the content is confirmed
confirm.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

cancel.name: cancel
cancel.description: Fired if the change is cancelled.
cancel.helpDescription: Fired if the change is cancelled.
cancel.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

requestSwitchToDialog.name: requestSwitchToDialog
requestSwitchToDialog.description: Fired if the value help should switch to dialog mode.
requestSwitchToDialog.helpDescription: Fired if the value help should switch to dialog mode.
requestSwitchToDialog.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

select.name: select

eventParams.oControlEvent.getParameters.conditions: type: object[], description: Changed conditions Note: A condition must have the structure of {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionObject ConditionObject}.
eventParams.oControlEvent.getParameters.type: type: sap.ui.mdc.enum.SelectType, description: Type of the selection change (add, remove)

select.description: Fired if the selected condition changed.
select.helpDescription: Fired if the selected condition changed.
select.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

parseError.name: parseError
parseError.description: Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated to the model, but parsing the value failed with an exception.
parseError.helpDescription: Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated to the model, but parsing the value failed with an exception.
parseError.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

validationSuccess.name: validationSuccess
validationSuccess.description: Fired after a new value for a bound property has been propagated to the model. Only fired, when the binding uses a data type.
validationSuccess.helpDescription: Fired after a new value for a bound property has been propagated to the model. Only fired, when the binding uses a data type.
validationSuccess.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

modelContextChange.name: modelContextChange
modelContextChange.description: Fired when models or contexts are changed on this object (either by calling setModel/setBindingContext or due to propagation)
modelContextChange.helpDescription: Fired when models or contexts are changed on this object (either by calling setModel/setBindingContext or due to propagation)
modelContextChange.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

navigated.name: navigated
navigated.description: Fired if a navigation was executed in the content
navigated.helpDescription: Fired if a navigation was executed in the content
navigated.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

validationError.name: validationError
validationError.description: Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated to the model, but validating the value failed with an exception.
validationError.helpDescription: Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated to the model, but validating the value failed with an exception.
validationError.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
